title: Jennifer Aniston remembers first time she saw herself on a billboard
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Jennifer Aniston has been a stalwart of the entertainment industry for eons, and has emerged on many a massive billboard.

But what was her first billboard sighting?

It’s got to be Friends, right? That plucky sitcom which catapulted her into the status of super, superstar in the 90s.

The star chatted with Jimmy Kimmel on Wednesday night and tried to recall the first moment she saw her face blown up to ridiculous proportions.

Advertisement

‘I would want to say Friends… I’m sure it was Friends,’ the Morning Show star strained herself to think.

Jen stored the memory in her mind (Picture: BACKGRID)

‘I had one vivid memory of [2004 film] Along Came Polly where I was driving on, I want to say, Fairfax or La Brea, right by the Wholefoods, and it was this huge…

‘That was the first time I saw a big, big horizontal poster with my name in the title.’

She added with a cheeky grin: ‘I thought it was pretty cool.’

It was in the age before smartphones were the norm and well before Jennifer had joined Instagram – which happened on Tuesday, if you were wondering – as Jimmy joked she wasn’t able to take a picture to share it for the world to see.

‘I didn’t but I did it right here,’ Jen laughed as she pointed to her head.

As Jimmy continued to joke it can’t go online if it’s in your head, she added, pointing to her heart: ‘No, but it goes into here.’

Can’t fault her logic.

The actor, 50, racked up over 11.5 million followers in one day after making her debut on the social media platform with a photo of her and the rest of the Friends cast, but has now admitted she’s been using the site for a while.

Jen told Jimmy that she’d been lurking on the site with a fake profile for ages, in order to get used to how it all works before making her debut.

Advertisement

She explained: ‘It was a stalker account, yes. When I was thinking about doing this I figured it was time to kind of understand the world [of Instagram] and dip my toe into the social media pool.’

Her debut on Instagram actually broke Guinness World Records, beating even Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s account for clocking up a million followers in just five hours and 16 minutes.

Jennifer admitted that the reason she decided to finally succumb to the ‘Gram is that people kept asking her to create an account so she finally gave in.

She explained: ‘I’m like the most reluctant person to join Instagram. What you resist, persists so what the hey, just do it.

‘I’m just trying to build content as they say. I’m going to try to be really good about it.’
